Description: Large black-topped bowl with splayed sides made of Nile silt pottery, red slipped and burnished on the exterior, blackened and fine vertical burnishing to high lustre on the interior.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Published: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo, Ravenna 1998, p.151 [49]. Marked 229 on base Similar to Black-topped red ware B11m in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery
